cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) southwest of Key West, Florida and 25 mi (40 km) northwest of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west across the Florida Straits into the southeastern Gulf, then forecast to slow, turn northwest, cross the Florida Big-Bend late Thursday, and accelerate northeast offshore the Carolina coast toward the western Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Peninsula, Georgia & Carolina coasts (cone extends into NC)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: OCEANA NAS VA (closest location listed in wind table to NY/NJ)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into Saturday if the system tracks farther north than forecast
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for NY & NJ while the system remains well south of the area
weather_observation.rainfall: Possibility of light fringe rain bands late week; heavy rainfall (≥4 in) not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Building swells, high surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore late week into the weekend
